Package Enginegames

Class Dialog

java.lang.Object
Enginegames.World
Enginegames.Dialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
Tickable, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.util.EventListener
public class Dialog
extends World
A class to ask the User for input. Only one Dialog may be opened at once

  • Field Details

    • font

      public static java.awt.Font font
      Font of the text when opening a new dialog. Default Value: a Serif, plain font of size 20

    • textColor

      public static java.awt.Color textColor
      The Color of the diplayed text Default Value: Color.WHITE

  • Method Details

    • tick

      public void tick()
      does nothing acutally
      Specified by:
      tick in interface Tickable
      Specified by:
      tick in class World

    • ask

      public static java.lang.Object ask​(java.lang.String dialog, java.lang.String initValue, int type)
      opens a new Dialog. Returns an object (boolean or String depending on type)
      Parameters:
      dialog - what the user is being asked
      initValue - the initial Value, first displayed in the textfield (does not apply for askConfirm(String, String...)
      type - the type of dialog opened
      Returns:
      the users response

    • askString

      public static java.lang.String askString​(java.lang.String dialog, java.lang.String... initValue)
      Asks the user for a string input.
      Parameters:
      dialog - the Message displayed to the user
      initValue - the initial value, displayed in the textfield
      Returns:
      the users response

    • askConfirm

      public static boolean askConfirm​(java.lang.String dialog, java.lang.String... initValue)
      Asks the user for confirmation
      Parameters:
      dialog - the Message displayed to the user
      initValue - just leave it empty. Doesn't do anything
      Returns:
      the users response

    • askNumber

      public static int askNumber​(java.lang.String dialog, java.lang.String... initValue)
      Asks the user to input an Integer (Number
      Parameters:
      dialog - The message diplayed to the user
      initValue - The initial Value, displayed in the Textfield
      Returns:
      the users response
